result.execSummary:
The defendant Kurtis L. King was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Kurtis L. King is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Kurtis L. King was found guilty of Possess/Illegally Obtained Prescription [Modifiers: Party to a Crime], an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 450.11(7)(h).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt:
1:29 p.m. Defendant Kurtis L. King in court with attorney Michael John Rielly.  Defendant Kurtis L. King in custody.  Michael William Schiek appeared for the State of Wisconsin. State moves to dismiss Counts 2 and 3 - Granted. State moves to amend Count 1 to a violation of 450.11(7)(h) - Granted. Plea questionnaire filed. Defendant enters no contest plea.   Court reads on waiver of rights and tendering plea. Waiver free and voluntary. Court finds that a factual basis for the plea exists and finds defendant guilty. Schiek/Rielly/Court statement on sentencing. Reilly request for Substance Abuse Program to continue. Court states if successfully completes Substance Abuse Program - Court would consider as a new factor in sentencing in this case. 
Court Sentence
Jail - 6 months cc with current prison sentence
Fine remitted
DNA Sample 
  The court informs defendant of right to request expungement of the DNA under Wis. Stat. 165.77(4).
Appeal rights given. Payment plan application given.
Adj. 1:42 p.m.
States Reply to Discovery  and State's Demand for Discovery  - includes cover letter

2:10 p.m. Defendant Kurtis L. King in court, in custody, with attorney Michael John Rielly.  Steven Mitchell Michlig, Asst. DA, appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Rielly apologizes for his lateness. State calls Kyle Parish, RPD/task force investigator, sworn, direct. Witness identifies defendant. Cross by Rielly; questioned by the Court. State's Exh. 1 (Jessica Steinmetz CCAP info.), marked, offered, received. Rielly motions the Court to dismiss Cts. 1, 2, & 3. Michlig response. Rielly statement. Court statement - references s. 939.31/s. 939.05(2)(c); denies motion to dismiss; finds probable cause exists and binds defendant over for trial. Information filed. Counsel in receipt of Information; waive reading. Defendant pleads not guilty to all three counts. Rielly requests Writ quashed to spend time in general population; Court quashes Writ. Bond continued.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for November 3, 2015 at 03:00 pm.

1:40 p.m. Defendant Kurtis L. King, via video, in court with attorney J Michael Riley.  Defendant Kurtis L. King in custody.  Steven Mitchell Michlig appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   In receipt of complaint, waive reading -set for preliminary hearing - Time limits waived. Michlig to bond. Court will not set bond at this time. Preliminary hearing scheduled for September 11, 2015 at 01:30 pm. Adj. 1:41 p.m.

01:46 pm - Defendant Kurtis L. King in court, via video, in custody from Red Granite.  Jodie L. Bednar appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant states does not have copy of criminal complaint.  Attorney John Voorhees appears on behalf of the PD office and is appearing on behalf of that office.  Has not been assigned to case.  Defendant's mother contacted PD office this past Friday.  Court reviews criminal complaint to defendant, right to counsel.  Court sets over to next Monday.  Initial appearance scheduled for August 3, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
